main event: A senior pilot observed an unknown object believed to be an earth satellite on 24 November 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as having the shape of a star and changing brightness over a 30-second period., The pilot initially thought it was a falling meteorite before determining it was larger and more distant., The object made an arc across the pilot's flight path at a maximum elevation of 22Â°., The sighting occurred at 1725Z during clear night conditions approximately 90 miles northeast of Iceland., No interception actions were taken and there was no physical evidence related to the sighting.
sighted object: unknown object believed to be an earth satellite
witness description: Captain and crew including navigator and weather observer
